campaign_structure.name: Elder Scrolls TTRPG Campaign Module - Civil War and Thalmor Conspiracy
campaign_structure.description: The Civil War erupts in Skyrim as the Thalmor pull strings from the shadows. Choose sides, navigate faction politics, and determine Skyrim's fate.
campaign_structure.source_material: Elder Scrolls TTRPG Source Material, Side Plot C - Allegiances in War

act_i.name: Battle and Beginnings
act_i.description: The pivotal Battle of Whiterun forces all to choose sides in the Civil War. Players establish faction allegiances while discovering covert Thalmor manipulation.

act_ii.name: Fractured Skyrim
act_ii.description: Hold-based conflicts swing the Civil War as Thalmor sabotage intensifies. Players balance faction trust while handling Talos worship persecution and infiltrating enemy operations.

act_iii.name: Skyrim's Fate and Thalmor Endgame
act_iii.description: Decisive battles for Windhelm or Solitude determine Skyrim's future. The Thalmor emerge as the ultimate threat as their manipulation peaks, forcing military and political dilemmas.

main_questline.name: The Civil War and Thalmor Conspiracy
main_questline.description: Navigate the brutal Civil War while uncovering and confronting the Thalmor's manipulation of Skyrim

battle_of_whiterun.name: Battle of Whiterun
battle_of_whiterun.description: The civil war erupts in Whiterun as either the Imperials defend or the Stormcloaks attack. The party must choose sides in this pivotal battle that will shape Skyrim's future.
objectives: Stage 0: Attend the pre-battle briefing with your faction's commanders
Stage 1: Repel or breach the first line of defenders (Dragonsreach infiltrators or outer barricades)
Stage 2: Fight through the district approach and accomplish key side tasks
Stage 3: Resolve the Hadvar/Ralof confrontation at the Gildergreen
Stage 4: Stabilize the inner district and route remaining resistance
Stage 5: Achieve the climax objective (gatehouse break or Dragonsreach climax)

key_set_pieces: District approach with civilian rescue and temple defense tasks
Hadvar vs Ralof confrontation at the Gildergreen
Inner district sweep with loot hooks and sabotage prevention
Climax: gatehouse break (Imperial) or Dragonsreach surrender/combat (Stormcloak)
dragonbreak_triggers: Hadvar or Ralof killed (if major-canon ally)
battle_overview.see_also: civil_war_quests.json battle_of_whiterun for full stage data

branching_choice.choice: Support Imperials, Support Stormcloaks, or Remain Neutral

consequences.imperial: Balgruuf remains Jarl, Whiterun joins Empire, Stormcloak relations -20
consequences.stormcloak: Vignar Gray-Mane becomes Jarl, Whiterun joins Stormcloaks, Imperial relations -20
consequences.neutral: Attempt to broker temporary peace, all factions suspicious, future diplomatic options

scene_triggers.trigger: Campaign begins with rumors of war
scene_triggers.scene: Whiterun is in turmoil. Jarl Balgruuf attempts neutrality but pressure from both sides intensifies. Messengers arrive demanding allegiance.
Stormcloak forces assault the main gate. Defend the barricades alongside Whiterun guards.
Join the Stormcloak assault force. Breach the gates and fight to Dragonsreach.

combat_waves.enemies: Irileth and Elite Guards at Dragonsreach (3-4)

scene_triggers.scene: Thalmor Justiciars led by Elenwen arrive to 'observe.' They're taking notes and seem pleased by the bloodshed.
scene_triggers.player_discovery: Perceptive characters (Notice vs Good +3) spot Thalmor handing intelligence to the losing side to prolong the battle

scene_triggers.scene: Victory is achieved. The new or retained Jarl addresses the hold. The party's role is recognized.

outcomes.imperial_victory: Balgruuf thanks the party. Whiterun now firmly Imperial.
outcomes.stormcloak_victory: Vignar Gray-Mane installed. Balgruuf exiled to Solitude.
outcomes.neutral_intervention: Temporary ceasefire. Both sides resentful but recognize the party's strength.

items: Weapon of Whiterun (enchanted blade or axe)
rewards.world_consequence: Whiterun's allegiance is decided, civil war becomes personal

thalmor.reaction: Increased surveillance. Begin planning to control or eliminate party.
thalmor.subtle_manipulation: Start spreading rumors about party's true allegiance

whiterun_citizens.reaction: Mixed - grateful for protection but mourning losses

story_hooks: The Thalmor are benefiting from the civil war - evidence of their manipulation
Both sides seek the party as valuable assets
The battle has demonstrated the party's power to all factions
Elenwen personally takes interest in tracking the party
battle_of_whiterun.gm_notes: This is the opening blow. The Battle of Whiterun forces the party to take a stand. The Thalmor subplot should be subtly introduced here if players are observant. Allow creative solutions like trying to minimize casualties or exposing Thalmor interference. This sets the tone for the entire campaign.

divided_loyalties.name: Divided Loyalties
divided_loyalties.description: In the aftermath of Whiterun's fall, the party must establish their position within their chosen faction or navigate the treacherous neutral path. Faction politics and guild allegiances complicate matters.
objectives: Report to faction leadership after the battle
Receive first official assignment as recognized operatives
Build relationships with key NPCs (Companions, Thieves Guild, College, etc.)
Navigate conflicting loyalties between factions
Uncover first hints of wider Thalmor conspiracy

branching_choice.choice: Fully commit to civil war faction, maintain guild ties, or play multiple sides

consequences.faction_commitment: Deep trust with faction, locked out of opposing faction, special missions
consequences.guild_focus: More freedom, moderate trust with civil war factions, guild resources
consequences.multiple_sides: Flexibility but constant suspicion, opportunities for espionage

scene_triggers.scene: Either General Tullius in Solitude or Ulfric Stormcloak in Windhelm summons the party. Formal recognition and new orders.

faction_specific_dialogue.imperial: Tullius: 'The Battle of Whiterun was costly, but necessary. We need operatives we can trust. Are you prepared to serve the Empire fully?'
faction_specific_dialogue.stormcloak: Ulfric: 'You fought well at Whiterun. True sons and daughters of Skyrim. But the war is far from over. Will you stand with us to the end?'

scene_triggers.scene: Jorrvaskr hosts a victory feast (or mourning ceremony). Vilkas, Aela, or other Companions seek the party's counsel on the civil war's impact.
scene_triggers.social_encounter: Companions traditionally stay out of politics, but the war affects everyone. Party's guidance could sway their stance.

scene_triggers.scene: Maven Black-Briar or Brynjolf reaches out. The war affects business, and the Guild needs to know where the party stands.
scene_triggers.player_discovery: Thieves Guild has been hired by unknown patron (Thalmor) to steal civil war intelligence

scene_triggers.scene: Party notices they're being followed. Thalmor agents are gathering intelligence on them.

stealth_challenge.success: Identify Thalmor agent, opportunity to confront or follow
stealth_challenge.failure: Agents escape, party is clearly on Thalmor radar

scene_triggers.scene: Faction assigns first strategic mission: secure a hold, investigate enemy movements, or protect supply lines.

mission_types.imperial: Secure Falkreath Hold from Stormcloak agitators
mission_types.stormcloak: Rally support in the Reach, undermine Imperial influence
mission_types.neutral: Investigate reports of third party (Thalmor) manipulation

rewards.contacts: Key NPCs in guilds and factions become allies

chosen_faction.status: Trusted operative, access to faction resources

companions.future_hook: May be recruited for major battles

thalmor.priority_target: Party identified as persons of interest

story_hooks: Factions beyond civil war (guilds) offer different perspectives
Thalmor surveillance begins in earnest
Party's reputation spreads across Skyrim
Conflicting loyalties create moral dilemmas
divided_loyalties.gm_notes: This quest establishes the party's place in the world post-Whiterun. Allow players to engage with their favorite factions. The civil war should feel like one layer of a complex political landscape. Plant seeds of the Thalmor conspiracy through suspicious observations.

the_reach_conspiracy.name: The Reach Conspiracy
the_reach_conspiracy.description: The Reach is a powder keg. Forsworn raids intensify, Silver-Blood and Thalmor interests clash, and the party discovers that Markarth's conflicts run deeper than the civil war.
objectives: Travel to Markarth to investigate instability
Navigate Forsworn attacks and Silver-Blood politics
Uncover Thalmor involvement in Reach conflicts
Choose how to handle Cidhna Mine situation
Secure or destabilize the Reach for your faction

branching_choice.choice: Support Silver-Bloods, aid Forsworn cause, or expose all corruption

consequences.silver_bloods: Reach stabilizes for your faction, but injustice continues, Thalmor influence hidden
consequences.forsworn: Chaos in the Reach, both civil war factions weakened, Thalmor capitalize on disorder
consequences.expose_all: Silver-Blood corruption and Thalmor manipulation revealed, temporary chaos but long-term stability

scene_triggers.scene: A woman is murdered in the market. Guards blame Forsworn. Investigation reveals deeper conspiracy.
Following leads reveals Forsworn agents, corrupt guards, and Silver-Blood involvement.
evidence_gathered: Forsworn are organized, not random raiders
Thalmor agents are meeting with both sides

scene_triggers.scene: Party discovers Thalmor have been arming Forsworn while advising Silver-Bloods. Goal: perpetual conflict.
scene_triggers.player_discovery: Thalmor dossier on Markarth: 'Maintain instability. Forsworn conflict prevents unified Reach resistance to Dominion.'

scene_triggers.scene: If investigation goes too far, Silver-Bloods frame party. Thrown into Cidhna Mine prison.
Meet Madanach, King in Rags, leader of imprisoned Forsworn. He offers alliance against Silver-Bloods and Thalmor.

social_encounter.madanach_goals: Freedom for Forsworn, revenge on Silver-Bloods

scene_triggers.scene: Party can expose or confront Thalmor Agent Ondolemar about his manipulation.

social_or_combat.social: Deceive vs Great (+4) to extract information or gain leverage

scene_triggers.scene: Markarth's fate is decided. Jarl may change, Silver-Blood power may break, Forsworn may gain legitimacy.
scene_triggers.outcomes_affect: Reach stability, faction control, Thalmor influence

items: Silver-Blood Family Ring OR Forsworn tribal armor
rewards.world_consequence: The Reach's allegiance or chaos affects civil war

chosen_faction.if_reach_secured: Reputation +25, strategic advantage in west Skyrim

forsworn.status: Can become allies or implacable enemies

silver_bloods.reputation: Variable based on alliance or exposure
silver_bloods.economic_impact: Control of silver mines affects war funding

thalmor.manipulation_revealed: First major evidence of Thalmor puppet-mastery

story_hooks: The Reach shows Thalmor manipulate more than just civil war factions
Forsworn conflict is manufactured to keep Skyrim divided
Silver-Bloods may become civil war allies or obstacles
Evidence gathering for eventual Thalmor confrontation
the_reach_conspiracy.gm_notes: The Reach is morally complex. There are no pure good guys. Allow players to engage with the moral ambiguity. The Forsworn have legitimate grievances but use terrorism. Silver-Bloods are corrupt but bring stability. Thalmor manipulate everyone. This quest should make players question simple faction loyalty.

shield_or_storm.name: Shield or Storm
shield_or_storm.description: The party leads their first major operation for their faction: securing a key hold, conducting raids, or gathering intelligence. Success here cements their role in the war.
objectives: Receive strategic assignment from faction leadership
Plan and execute military or covert operation
Deal with unexpected complications (Thalmor interference)
Achieve primary objective despite opposition
Witness the human cost of war

branching_choice.choice: Aggressive assault, covert infiltration, or diplomatic solution

consequences.assault: High casualties, decisive victory or defeat, reputation as warriors
consequences.covert: Fewer losses, intelligence gained, reputation as strategists
consequences.diplomatic: Bloodless if successful, both sides may resent interference

scene_triggers.scene: Faction leadership reveals strategic objective: capture fort, raid supply lines, or secure hold.

mission_details.imperial_mission: Secure Fort Greymoor, cut Stormcloak supply route
mission_details.stormcloak_mission: Raid Imperial convoy, seize weapons and gold

scene_triggers.scene: Party coordinates with faction soldiers. Choose approach and gather resources.
Execute chosen strategy. Encounter enemy forces and battlefield challenges.
Mid-operation, Thalmor agents appear. They're sabotaging both sides to prolong the fight.
scene_triggers.player_discovery: Thalmor planted false intelligence to ensure maximum casualties for both sides

branching_choice.choice: Deal with Thalmor immediately or focus on primary objective

consequences.fight_thalmor: Thalmor stopped but primary objective harder, enemy faction may escape
consequences.ignore_thalmor: Objective achieved but Thalmor escape with intelligence, future sabotage likely

scene_triggers.scene: Encounter enemy wounded, civilians caught in crossfire, or chance to show mercy.
scene_triggers.npc_reactions: Faction leadership and soldiers judge party's character

scene_triggers.scene: Mission succeeds or fails. Faction leadership assesses performance and casualties.

outcomes.decisive_victory: Faction gains strategic advantage, party celebrated
outcomes.costly_victory: Objective achieved but heavy losses, somber recognition
outcomes.failure: Setback for faction, party must redeem themselves

scene_triggers.scene: Party witnesses war's toll: wounded soldiers, destroyed homesteads, grieving families.
scene_triggers.thematic_moment: The glory of battle fades when confronted with its cost
scene_triggers.npc_interaction: Surviving soldier or civilian questions if any side is worth this bloodshed

opposing_faction.status: Priority target, wanted for major operation

thalmor.if_discovered_sabotage: Evidence of active Thalmor military interference

story_hooks: War's human cost becomes personal
Thalmor are actively interfering in military operations
Party's growing reputation makes them targets
Question whether any faction truly serves Skyrim's interests
shield_or_storm.gm_notes: This quest should feel like a genuine military operation with stakes and consequences. Balance action with moral weight. The Thalmor interference should be shocking and anger-inducing. Show war's reality: it's not glorious, it's tragic. Player choices in mercy vs ruthlessness should matter for reputation and future interactions.

whispers_of_gold.name: Whispers of Gold
whispers_of_gold.description: A mysterious contact (Delphine or similar operative) reaches out with disturbing intelligence: the Thalmor conspiracy goes deeper than anyone suspected. Time to start investigating.
objectives: Meet with mysterious informant
Learn about wider Thalmor manipulation
Gather initial evidence of conspiracy
Decide whether to investigate Thalmor or focus on civil war
Prepare for deeper infiltration

branching_choice.choice: Fully commit to investigating Thalmor, or remain focused on civil war

consequences.investigate_thalmor: Unlock Act II Thalmor conspiracy quests, risk Thalmor wrath
consequences.civil_war_focus: Strengthen faction position, remain ignorant of true threat
consequences.balanced_approach: Juggle both priorities, spread thin but informed

scene_triggers.scene: An anonymous message requests meeting at remote location. 'The war is a lie. Meet me if you want the truth.'
Delphine (or faction intelligence officer) reveals evidence of Thalmor manipulation.
reveals: Thalmor have agents in both civil war factions
Evidence suggests coordination from Thalmor Embassy
Dossiers exist on key figures including Ulfric Stormcloak

scene_triggers.scene: Examine documents, intercepted communications, and witness testimonies.
evidence_pieces: Gold shipments to both Stormcloak and Imperial saboteurs
Reports of Thalmor pleasure at battle casualties
References to 'Embassy archives' containing master plan

scene_triggers.scene: Thalmor have tracked the meeting. Agents attack to eliminate witnesses and recover evidence.
scene_triggers.stakes: Evidence could be destroyed, informant killed

scene_triggers.scene: After surviving ambush, must decide: pursue Thalmor conspiracy or continue civil war focus.

npc_arguments.delphine: 'The civil war is exactly what they want. We need to expose them before Skyrim tears itself apart.'
npc_arguments.faction_leader: 'We can't afford distractions. Win the war first, deal with Thalmor later.'

scene_triggers.scene: If choosing to investigate: Begin planning Embassy infiltration. If not: Receive new civil war assignment.
scene_triggers.preparation: Gather resources, contacts, and intelligence for Act II

rewards.intel: Evidence of Thalmor conspiracy, usable for Act II quests
rewards.contact: Delphine or intelligence officer becomes recurring ally

thalmor.escalation: Thalmor begin active measures to eliminate party

chosen_faction.if_informed: Leadership may be skeptical or concerned about Thalmor

story_hooks: The civil war is a Thalmor plot - proof is in the Embassy
Ulfric Stormcloak may have been manipulated or controlled
Thalmor are actively hunting the party now
Must choose between winning battles or winning the real war
Act II will involve infiltration and espionage
whispers_of_gold.gm_notes: This is the transition quest that opens Act II. It should feel like pulling back the curtain to reveal the true scope of the conspiracy. The Thalmor ambush makes it personal and dangerous. Player choice here determines whether they engage deeply with the Thalmor plot or remain civil war focused. Both are valid, but investigating Thalmor is the 'main path' with richer story.

shadows_in_the_aftermath.name: Shadows in the Aftermath
shadows_in_the_aftermath.description: Evidence suggests Thalmor agents are sabotaging both sides of the civil war. Investigate their activities and gather proof before infiltrating the Embassy.
objectives: Investigate reports of suspicious activities in holds
Track Thalmor agents in the field
Intercept Thalmor supply lines to saboteurs
Gather concrete evidence of manipulation
Prevent a Thalmor-orchestrated massacre or incident

branching_choice.choice: Confront Thalmor publicly, work with faction intelligence, or gather evidence quietly

consequences.public_confrontation: Thalmor become openly hostile. Elenwen sends assassins. Evidence lost but moral stand taken.
consequences.faction_cooperation: Share intel with chosen faction. They are grateful but Thalmor go deeper underground.
consequences.quiet_investigation: Gather damning evidence for Embassy infiltration. Thalmor do not realize you are onto them.

scene_triggers.scene: Multiple holds report suspicious incidents: poisoned supplies, assassinated officers, burned farms near strategic locations.
Disguised Thalmor agents transporting weapons and gold to a secret drop point. Ambush opportunity.
scene_triggers.loot: Thalmor supply manifest, encrypted orders, gold (1000 septims)

scene_triggers.scene: Thalmor agents meet with double agents from both sides. Plans for sabotage discussed.

stealth_challenge.failure_consequence: Agents flee, Thalmor alerted to investigation

scene_triggers.player_discovery: Names of traitors, locations of next sabotage targets, Thalmor timetable

scene_triggers.scene: Thalmor-backed operatives plan to poison food supplies or assassinate peace negotiators. Intervene to stop the attack.

combat_encounter.time_pressure: Must stop them before they complete mission

scene_triggers.scene: A Thalmor Justiciar named Rulindil confronts the party. He knows you are investigating.

social_encounter.rulindil_goals: Intimidate party, gauge their knowledge, eliminate if necessary

scene_triggers.scene: Return to informant/contact with evidence. This is worse than suspected. Time to plan the Embassy mission.
scene_triggers.unlocks: diplomatic_immunity quest with additional context and evidence

rewards.intel: Evidence of Thalmor manipulation usable in Embassy mission
rewards.bonus_for_diplomatic_immunity: +2 to investigation rolls at Embassy if evidence gathered

thalmor.status: Actively hostile. Assassins and sabotage attempts likely.

story_hooks: Thalmor are playing both sides - their goal is endless war
Elenwen is the mastermind but operates with diplomatic immunity
The Embassy holds more secrets about their plans
Some Thalmor may defect if approached correctly
shadows_in_the_aftermath.gm_notes: This mission ties the civil war and Thalmor conspiracy together. Players should feel clever discovering the plot. Allow multiple approaches. If players skip this, they miss valuable intel for the Embassy but can still proceed. The Thalmor become recurring antagonists.

the_rift_gambit.name: The Rift Gambit
the_rift_gambit.description: The Rift is strategically vital. Maven Black-Briar schemes, Thieves Guild operates, and Thalmor seek to control Riften. Navigate this web of corruption to secure or destabilize the hold.
objectives: Travel to Riften and assess the political landscape
Navigate Maven Black-Briar s influence
Interact with Thieves Guild operations
Uncover Thalmor attempts to control Riften
Choose how to resolve Riften's fate

branching_choice.choice: Ally with Maven, side with reformers, or expose all corruption

consequences.maven_alliance: Riften secured for your faction, criminal empire empowered
consequences.reformers: Maven weakened, unstable transition, Thalmor interference
consequences.expose_all: Chaos in Riften, but chance for genuine reform

scene_triggers.scene: Corruption is obvious. Guards demand bribes, Maven Black-Briar openly controls the Jarl.
Brynjolf approaches. The Guild wants to know where party stands. They have information on Thalmor.
scene_triggers.intel_offered: Thalmor are trying to infiltrate Guild to control Riften information network

scene_triggers.scene: Maven summons party. She offers alliance: help secure Riften for your faction, she ensures compliance.
Thalmor have blackmail material on Jarl Laila. They're pulling strings from the shadows.
scene_triggers.investigation: Find evidence in Jarl s palace or Thalmor agent s hideout
scene_triggers.combat_or_stealth: Infiltrate and steal evidence without alerting Thalmor

scene_triggers.scene: Citizens tired of corruption. A grassroots movement seeks to expose Maven and restore integrity.
scene_triggers.risky_alliance: Reformers lack power but offer moral alternative

scene_triggers.scene: Decide Riften's fate: empower Maven for stability, back reformers for justice, or expose everyone including Thalmor.
scene_triggers.affects: Riften's civil war allegiance, Thieves Guild relations, Thalmor influence

rewards.world_consequence: Riften's alignment affects war, Thieves Guild alliance secured or denied

story_hooks: Maven Black-Briar is pragmatically useful but morally corrupt
Thalmor seek to control information networks
Thieves Guild can be powerful ally against Thalmor
Winning the war may require dirty hands
the_rift_gambit.gm_notes: The Rift presents a classic dilemma: pragmatism vs idealism. Maven is effective but corrupt. Reformers are noble but weak. Thalmor exploit both. Let players wrestle with the choice. The Thieves Guild can become valuable allies if respected.

falkreath_s_shadow.name: Falkreath's Shadow
falkreath_s_shadow.description: Falkreath Hold, with its border position and ancient cemetery, holds dark secrets. Necromancy, banditry, and Thalmor schemes converge in this strategic location.
objectives: Investigate disturbing reports from Falkreath Hold
Uncover necromantic activities in ancient barrows
Deal with bandit lords controlling trade routes
Discover Thalmor involvement in dark magic
Secure Falkreath for civil war or expose threats

branching_choice.choice: Secure hold militarily, cleanse necromantic threat first, or expose Thalmor necromancy

consequences.military: Hold secured quickly, necromancy persists in shadows
consequences.cleanse_first: Delayed civil war gains, safer long-term
consequences.expose_thalmor: Revelation shocks Skyrim, Thalmor use of forbidden magic revealed

scene_triggers.scene: The town is overshadowed by its massive graveyard. Reports of undead and missing travelers are common.
Ancient Nordic tombs are being desecrated. Someone is raising the dead for an army.
Bandit lords control key roads. They have unusual equipment - Thalmor supplied.

combat_encounter.evidence: Thalmor gold and orders found on chief

scene_triggers.scene: Hidden Thalmor facility found in deep forest. They are experimenting with raising armies of undead to prolong the war.
scene_triggers.horrifying_discovery: Thalmor are willing to use any means, even forbidden magic, to keep Skyrim weak

scene_triggers.scene: Assault Thalmor necromancy facility. Stop the rituals and free the dead.
Falkreath is secured or cleansed. Jarl acknowledges party s service. Evidence of Thalmor necromancy is damning.
scene_triggers.world_impact: Thalmor reputation across Skyrim drops significantly if exposed

rewards.world_consequence: Falkreath secured, Thalmor reputation destroyed if necromancy exposed

nords_generally.if_cleansed: +20 reputation, respect for honoring the dead

story_hooks: Thalmor have no moral limits - use necromancy without hesitation
The war is so beneficial to them they ll raise the dead to prolong it
Evidence mounting for Embassy infiltration
Common folk begin to see Thalmor as true evil
falkreath_s_shadow.gm_notes: Falkreath should feel creepy and dangerous. The necromancy angle shows Thalmor desperation and ruthlessness. This is horror mixed with political intrigue. Exposing the necromancy can turn public opinion strongly against Thalmor. The undead army is a tangible threat that makes the conspiracy real.

diplomatic_immunity.name: Diplomatic Immunity
diplomatic_immunity.description: Infiltrate the Thalmor Embassy to uncover their true agenda. Gather proof of their manipulation of the civil war and discover their ultimate plans for Skyrim.
objectives: Plan the infiltration with contacts
Prepare for the party (gather equipment, arrange smuggling)
Attend Elenwen's party at the Thalmor Embassy
Blend in and gather intelligence socially
Sneak into the restricted archives
Discover Thalmor documents about civil war manipulation and Skyrim s future
Escape before being caught

scene_triggers.scene: Contact explains the plan. Malborn, a Wood Elf who hates the Thalmor, will smuggle equipment in. Party will attend as guests.
scene_triggers.preparation_phase: Choose what gear to smuggle (limited), what to wear, and cover story

scene_triggers.scene: Elenwen's grand party in full swing. Nobles, diplomats, and military officers mingling. Elenwen recognizes party.
social_challenges: Convince Elenwen you are just guests (Deceive vs Great +4)
scene_triggers.time_pressure: Limited time before absence is noticed

scene_triggers.scene: Create a distraction or slip away unnoticed. Malborn leads to service entrance.

stealth_challenge.failure: Guards become alert, higher difficulty for rest of mission

scene_triggers.scene: Locked rooms filled with dossiers and intelligence reports. Find documents about civil war manipulation.
documents_found: Thalmor Dossier: Ulfric Stormcloak - Asset manipulated during captivity
Civil War Strategy: Prolong conflict indefinitely, prevent decisive victory
Operation Eternal War: Keep Skyrim weak for eventual annexation
Target List: Key Nord leaders to eliminate after war concludes

scene_triggers.scene: Alarm raised! Thalmor guards rush the area. Must fight or flee to extraction point.
Race through the Embassy to Malborn's escape route. Entire Embassy on alert.
If players are bold, Elenwen blocks the exit. She knows who they are and what they have done.
scene_triggers.elenwen_dialogue: So, meddlers who fancy themselves heroes. You have signed your death warrants.
scene_triggers.consequences: Elenwen becomes personal nemesis. Thalmor assassins dispatched.

scene_triggers.scene: Safe location. Contact reviews the documents. The conspiracy is worse than imagined.
reveals: Thalmor want neither faction to win the civil war
Ulfric was manipulated during captivity, possibly broken and rebuilt
Ultimate goal is Skyrim annexation after prolonged weakening
Thalmor have death lists for post-war purges
Party is now on Thalmor hit list

rewards.intel: Complete Thalmor dossiers on key figures
items: Thalmor weapon or armor from escape
rewards.reputation: Infamous among Thalmor, respected by all factions if intel shared

branching_choice.choice: Share Thalmor intel with civil war factions or keep it secret

consequences.share_with_imperials: Imperial reputation +20, better positioned to end war quickly
consequences.share_with_stormcloaks: Stormcloak reputation +20, Ulfric questions his own judgment
consequences.share_with_both: Both factions grateful but neither trusts fully, peace talks possible
consequences.keep_secret: Use as leverage later, Thalmor do not know how much was learned

thalmor.status: Shoot on sight. Assassins and sabotage active.
thalmor.elenwen_reaction: Personal vendetta. Will appear in future confrontations.

civil_war_factions.if_intel_shared: Awareness of Thalmor manipulation. May affect war strategy.
civil_war_factions.reputation_boost: +25 to chosen faction, +10 to both if shared with both

story_hooks: Thalmor are now personal enemies hunting the party
Civil war is being manipulated - can this knowledge change anything?
Ulfric may have been mind-controlled during the Great War
Thalmor ultimate goal is Skyrim annexation
Evidence can be used to broker peace or win the war
diplomatic_immunity.gm_notes: This is the major conspiracy reveal. The Thalmor are the true villains pulling strings. Allow creative infiltration approaches. The escape should feel tense and dangerous. Elenwen becomes a recurring antagonist. The intel fundamentally changes the political landscape if shared wisely. This quest is the climax of Act II.

blood_and_silver.name: Blood and Silver
blood_and_silver.description: Armed with evidence of Thalmor manipulation, the party must decide how to use it. Meanwhile, the civil war reaches a critical juncture that cannot be ignored.
objectives: Decide how to use Thalmor evidence
Present findings to faction leadership or both sides
Navigate political fallout of revelations
Participate in crucial civil war operation
Position Skyrim for Act III endgame

branching_choice.choice: Push for peace talks, escalate to finish war, or continue balanced conflict

consequences.peace_talks: Attempt Season Unending, Thalmor furious, difficult negotiations
consequences.escalate: Final battles of civil war, decisive conclusion, Thalmor desperate
consequences.balanced: War continues but informed, Thalmor scramble to maintain control

scene_triggers.scene: Show Thalmor dossiers to faction leadership. Reactions range from shock to vindication.
scene_triggers.imperial_reaction: Tullius: We knew they were troublemakers, but this... This is an act of war.
scene_triggers.stormcloak_reaction: Ulfric: (shaken) They... broke me. Everything I have done, everything I believed... was it ever mine?

scene_triggers.scene: Evidence changes everything. Some call for united front against Thalmor. Others say win war first.
scene_triggers.debate: Peace vs continued war vs Thalmor focus
scene_triggers.party_influence: Party s reputation determines weight of their counsel

scene_triggers.scene: Elenwen unleashes assets. Assassins, sabotage, false flag operations to discredit party and evidence.
Regardless of political choices, civil war reaches flashpoint. Major battle for key hold.

major_combat.siege_or_defense: Large-scale battle with party in critical role

scene_triggers.scene: Aftermath of battle and political maneuvering. Stage is set for final act.
outcomes: Peace talks arranged for Act III

rewards.reputation: Heroes or villains depending on faction, but universally known

all_factions.status: Party cannot be ignored. Opinions vary but influence is real.

thalmor.status: Top priority elimination targets. No quarter.

story_hooks: Act III will resolve civil war and Thalmor threat
Party choices here determine final act structure
Skyrim s fate hangs in balance
Thalmor are cornered and most dangerous
blood_and_silver.gm_notes: This is the transition to Act III. Consequences of all previous choices come together. Allow party to shape how the endgame unfolds. The evidence from the Embassy is game-changing if used well. Set up the final confrontations.

season_unending.name: Season Unending
season_unending.description: Broker a peace or truce between the Empire and Stormcloaks. With evidence of Thalmor manipulation, there is a chance to unite Skyrim against the true threat.
season_unending.required_if: Civil war still unresolved or party pushes for peace
objectives: Convince both sides to attend peace talks
Host negotiations at neutral location (High Hrothgar suggested)
Present evidence of Thalmor manipulation
Negotiate terms of peace or truce
Secure agreement despite Thalmor interference

scene_triggers.scene: Using reputation and evidence, party calls for peace talks. Both sides reluctantly agree.
General Tullius, Legate Rikke, Ulfric Stormcloak, and Galmar Stone-Fist arrive. Tension is palpable.
scene_triggers.initial_conflict: Both sides blame each other for the war

scene_triggers.scene: Elenwen arrives uninvited, claiming Thalmor interest in peace. Ulfric becomes enraged.

branching_choice.choice: Allow Elenwen to stay or demand she leaves

consequences.elenwen_stays: Ulfric furious (-15 Stormcloak relations), Tullius grateful (+10 Imperial), negotiations harder
consequences.elenwen_expelled: Tullius annoyed (-5 Imperial), Ulfric pleased (+15 Stormcloak), Thalmor deeply offended, negotiations easier

scene_triggers.recommended: Expel Elenwen using evidence of manipulation

scene_triggers.scene: Reveal Thalmor dossiers. Both sides shocked by extent of manipulation.
scene_triggers.impact: Massive shift in dynamics. Common enemy revealed.
scene_triggers.ulfric_reaction: They used me. Everything I fought for... was it what they wanted all along?
scene_triggers.tullius_reaction: By the Eight... They played us all for fools.

scene_triggers.scene: Discuss territorial concessions, Talos worship, prisoners, and future of Skyrim.
negotiation_mechanics: Focus on Thalmor threat as unifier

scene_triggers.scene: Ulfric demands recognition of betrayal. Tullius bound by Concordat.
scene_triggers.resolution: Acknowledge grievances while focusing on future

scene_triggers.scene: Critical sticking point. With Thalmor exposed, more flexibility exists.
scene_triggers.compromise: Agree to allow private worship, work toward Concordat revision after Thalmor threat addressed

scene_triggers.scene: Terms are set. Both sides agree to peace or long-term truce. Skyrim will face Thalmor united.
terms_agreed: Ceasefire and peace (permanent or until Thalmor defeated)
scene_triggers.historic_moment: First peace between Empire and Stormcloaks since war began

rewards.reputation: +30 with both Imperial Legion and Stormcloaks
rewards.peace_achieved: Civil war ended or paused, unified Skyrim

branching_outcomes.successful_negotiation: Peace achieved, both sides cooperate against Thalmor
branching_outcomes.biased_toward_imperials: Imperials gain advantage, Stormcloaks resentful but compliant
branching_outcomes.biased_toward_stormcloaks: Stormcloaks gain advantage, Imperials resentful but compliant
branching_outcomes.failed_negotiation: No peace. Must resolve via military victory.

thalmor.status: All plans ruined. Desperate retaliation imminent.

story_hooks: United Skyrim is a threat to Thalmor
Elenwen and Thalmor will retaliate
True war now begins - against Thalmor
Party has achieved what seemed impossible
season_unending.gm_notes: Season Unending is a pure diplomatic mission. The evidence from the Embassy makes it possible. This should feel earned and momentous. Balance is key - favor one side too much and deal fails. Successfully uniting Skyrim changes everything for the finale.

siege_of_windhelm_or_solitude.name: Siege of Windhelm/Solitude
siege_of_windhelm_or_solitude.description: If peace was not achieved, the civil war reaches its climax. Assault or defend the enemy capital in a massive siege that will decide Skyrim s fate.
siege_of_windhelm_or_solitude.required_if: Civil war was not resolved peacefully
objectives: Prepare for the final siege
Lead assault or defense of capital city
Overcome enemy strongpoints and commanders
Prevent or execute Thalmor interference
Conclude the civil war decisively

scene_triggers.scene: Faction leader gives rousing speech. This is the final battle of the civil war.
Before battle, Thalmor try to assassinate commanders or sabotage supplies.

scene_triggers.trigger: Siege begins - Imperial assault on Windhelm
scene_triggers.scene: Battering ram on gates, siege weapons, waves of soldiers.

scene_triggers.trigger: Siege begins - Stormcloak assault on Solitude
scene_triggers.scene: Scale walls, breach gates, fight to Castle Dour.

massive_combat.objectives: Reach Tullius, prevent Thalmor escape with artifacts

scene_triggers.scene: Elenwen's forces intervene to prolong battle. Attack both sides.
scene_triggers.revelation: Even in defeat, Thalmor try to maximize damage to Skyrim

scene_triggers.scene: Face enemy leader: Ulfric in Palace of Kings or Tullius in Castle Dour.

boss_fight.enemy: Ulfric Stormcloak OR General Tullius + Elite Guards
boss_fight.choice: Kill or show mercy, execute or exile

scene_triggers.scene: Capital falls. Faction leader declares victory. Civil war is over.
Victory is hollow. Thalmor are still the real threat, and Skyrim is weakened by the war.
scene_triggers.realization: War cost Skyrim dearly. Thalmor have already won in some ways.

rewards.faction_victory: Civil war won for chosen faction
rewards.reputation: Hero of faction, war criminal to defeated faction

branching_outcomes.imperial_victory: Empire controls Skyrim. Ulfric dead or exiled. Order restored but Thalmor influence remains.
branching_outcomes.stormcloak_victory: Independent Skyrim. Tullius dead or exiled. Freedom achieved but Skyrim weakened and isolated.

thalmor.status: Furious civil war ended, prepare retaliation

skyrim_people.reaction: Relief war is over, but wounds run deep

story_hooks: Civil war is over but Skyrim is weakened
Thalmor are still the real threat
Skyrim must now face external threat
Healing and reconciliation needed
siege_of_windhelm_or_solitude.gm_notes: The siege should be epic and brutal. Show the cost of war. Even in victory, emphasize that Skyrim has lost much. The Thalmor interference demonstrates they were the true enemy all along. Set stage for final confrontation with Thalmor.

thalmor_endgame.name: Thalmor Endgame
thalmor_endgame.description: With civil war resolved, the Thalmor reveal their true intentions. Elenwen and her forces prepare a final scheme to subjugate or destroy Skyrim. The party must stop them.
objectives: Uncover Thalmor final plan
Rally Skyrim s factions against Thalmor
Assault Thalmor strongpoint or stop their operation
Confront Elenwen and Thalmor leadership
Secure Skyrim s freedom from Dominion manipulation

scene_triggers.scene: With civil war ended, Thalmor no longer hide. Direct attacks on Nord settlements and Talos shrines.
scene_triggers.thalmor_aggression: Open warfare, Justiciars rounding up Talos worshippers

scene_triggers.scene: Intelligence reveals Thalmor are preparing major operation: summon Daedric forces, poison water supplies, or assassinate all leadership.
scene_triggers.horrifying_plot: Thalmor plan is genocidal or enslaving

scene_triggers.scene: Party calls on all allies: civil war factions, guilds, Jarls. United front against Thalmor.
npc_present: All major faction leaders party has allied with
scene_triggers.unity_moment: Former enemies stand together against Thalmor threat

scene_triggers.scene: Lead combined forces against Thalmor base of operations (Embassy reinforced or secret fortress).

massive_final_battle.allied_forces: Imperials, Stormcloaks, guild members, common soldiers
massive_final_battle.enemies: Thalmor Justiciars, Soldiers, Wizards, summoned creatures

scene_triggers.scene: Face Elenwen in final confrontation. She is defiant and desperate.
scene_triggers.elenwen_dialogue: You think this changes anything? The Dominion is eternal. Skyrim will kneel eventually.
scene_triggers.choice: Kill, capture for trial, or exile

scene_triggers.scene: Thalmor forces are broken. Survivors flee Skyrim. Dominion influence is ended.
scene_triggers.victory: Skyrim has won its freedom from Thalmor manipulation

scene_triggers.scene: Faction leaders discuss what comes next. Thalmor defeat may anger Dominion, potential for larger war.
scene_triggers.future_uncertainty: Victory is real but Dominion may retaliate on larger scale

rewards.world_consequence: Thalmor expelled from Skyrim, their conspiracy ended

branching_outcomes.elenwen_killed: Martyrdom risk but Thalmor leadership broken
branching_outcomes.elenwen_captured: Trial and justice, Thalmor secrets extracted
branching_outcomes.elenwen_exiled: Mercy shown, potential for Thalmor peace faction

all_skyrim_factions.status: Legendary heroes, songs written about party

thalmor.dominion_reaction: High-level Dominion leaders may seek revenge

story_hooks: Skyrim is free but future is uncertain
Party has changed course of history
Larger conflict with Dominion may loom
Skyrim must rebuild and heal
thalmor_endgame.gm_notes: This is the climactic confrontation. Everything builds to this. Thalmor should be terrifying and desperate enemies. Elenwen is personal antagonist who has been present throughout. Make victory earned and epic. The united front of former enemies is powerful moment. Ending is triumphant but acknowledges larger world.

epilogue.name: Season's End
epilogue.description: The war is over. The Thalmor are defeated. Skyrim must rebuild. The party sees the consequences of their choices and determines their own futures.
objectives: Attend victory celebrations
See outcomes of major choices
Determine party s next steps
Resolve personal character arcs
Set stage for potential future campaigns

scene_triggers.scene: All Skyrim celebrates. Party is honored by Jarls, factions, and common people.
scene_triggers.atmosphere: Joy mixed with remembrance of fallen

scene_triggers.scene: See outcomes: which Jarls rule, how factions adapted, civilian recovery.
scene_triggers.world_state: Campaign choices have shaped Skyrim s future

scene_triggers.scene: Individual characters have moments with NPCs they connected with.
Discussion of future. Larger Dominion still exists. Other threats in Tamriel.
Party looks out over Skyrim from mountain peak. They have changed this land forever.
scene_triggers.thematic_resolution: Skyrim is free. The future is uncertain. But it is theirs to shape.

rewards.legendary_reputation: Heroes of Skyrim, names in history
rewards.titles_and_lands: Offered positions of power or land grants
rewards.retirement_option: Can end campaign here or continue to new adventures

epilogue.gm_notes: The epilogue should feel earned and satisfying. Show concrete outcomes of player choices throughout the campaign. Give each character spotlight moments. Leave door open for future campaigns if desired. End on hopeful but realistic note.

metadata.difficulty_curve: Starts intense with Battle of Whiterun, escalates through espionage in Act II, culminates in decisive conflicts in Act III
metadata.integration_notes: Designed to work with Side Plot C - Allegiances in War. Completely removes Dragonborn, Alduin, and dragon elements. Focuses on political intrigue, espionage, and the civil war as vehicle for Thalmor manipulation story.
gm_tips: The civil war should feel personal and morally complex
Thalmor are manipulative masterminds, not comic villains
Allow player agency in choosing sides and approaches
NPCs remember player choices and reference them
Balance combat, social encounters, and investigation
The conspiracy revelation should feel earned through investigation
Season Unending is optional but rewarding for diplomatic players
Military victory path is valid but bittersweet
United Skyrim ending is most satisfying but requires work
